intro: Remijia, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, dark green leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a compact shrub, with stems that often root at the nodes. Remijia thrives in humid, well-drained soil and requires indirect sunlight to flourish. Its ornamental value makes it a popular houseplant worldwide.
